SAC UT Arlington College of Engineering Norco College UCLA Engineering STEPCon Stevens Institute of Technology UC Riverside Commencement UCR Computer Science and Engineering - Graduate UC San Diego Jacobs School of Engineering The Henry Samueli School of Engineering at UC Irvine UC Irvine Civil & Environmental Engineering UCR Parents Association See More triangle-down Places Riverside, California Bourns College of Engineering at UC Riverside English (US)  ·  Español  ·  Português (Brasil)  ·  Français (France)  ·  Deutsch Privacy  ·  Terms  ·  Advertising  ·  Ad Choices  ·  Cookies  ·  More  Facebook © 2021 Posts Bourns College of Engineering at UC Riverside 1 hr  ·  Meet David Wong, one of our Class of 2021 student speakers. David has fought to protect underdogs his whole life, including spearheading a bill to help secure funding for Cal Grant recipients. Switching from outside BCOE, he choose bioengineering to find ways to assist people with tangible technologies in addition to policy changes. David served as the Operations Lead for BioHack, re-evaluating its budget and programming in a way that helped future hackathons succeed in a rem ... ote environment, and rekindled UCR's chess culture by assembling a Chess Club e-sports team that made it to the national playoffs. Before pursuing a master's in bioengineering, David will compete in the Deep Space Food Challenge to design nutritional technologies for future astronauts. In his graduation speech, he explores the meaning of "living the promise."  # BCOEGrad2021   # UCRGrad2021   # UC2021Grad   See More It looks like you may be having problems playing this video. If so, please try restarting your browser. Close BCOE Class of 2021 Student Speaker David Wong Posted by  Bourns College of Engineering at UC Riverside 14 Views Bourns College of Engineering at UC Riverside 2 hrs  ·  Meet Janine Huang, one of our Class of 2021 student speakers. A computer science student from Temple City, at BCOE Janine was actively involved as a student leader: serving as the first female chair of the Association for Computing Machinery (ACM@UCR) and a founding organizer of Rock Hack, UCR's first women-oriented hackathon. Now, Janine is now pursuing a master’s in Computer Science at UCR and is currently employed by NASA Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL). In her graduation speech, Janine reflects on the power of confident curiosity, and motivates her peers to surround themselves with a diverse support system.  # BCOEGrad2021   # UCRGrad2021   # UC2021Grad It looks like you may be having problems playing this video.
